catalog.author: George Orwell
catalog.description: A totalitarian government controls everything in an imagined future. When a government worker starts to think for himself, he faces dire consequences.

catalog.title: American Primitive
catalog.author: Mary Oliver
catalog.description: Oliver’s visionary poems explore wildness and wilderness in humans and in nature.

catalog.title: The Color Purple
catalog.author: Alice Walker
catalog.description: Letters between two sisters, one a missionary in Africa, and the other trapped in an abusive marriage in Georgia, shed light on the lived experience of rural African American women.

catalog.title: The God of Small Things
catalog.author: Arundhati Roy
catalog.description: In 1960s India, the lives of affluent twins Rahel and Estha are irreversibly changed upon the arrival of their English cousin.

catalog.title: Our Migrant Souls: A Meditation on Race and the Meanings and Myths of “Latino”
catalog.author: Héctor Tobar
catalog.description: A new book by the Pulitzer Prize – winning writer about the twenty-first-century Latino experience and identity. In Our Migrant Souls, the Pulitzer Prize–winning writer Héctor Tobar delivers a definitive and personal exploration of what it means to be Latino in the United States right now.

catalog.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
catalog.author: Douglas Adams
catalog.description: Arthur Dent and Ford Prefect set off on an interplanetary odyssey after the Earth is demolished to make way for an intergalactic freeway in this offbeat comedy.

catalog.title: Into Thin Air: A Personal Account of the Mt. Everest Disaster
catalog.author: Jon Krakauer
catalog.description: A first-hand account of the 1996 Mount Everest disaster, in which four expedition teams were trapped by a deadly storm.

catalog.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
catalog.author: Gabriel García Márquez
catalog.description: This pinnacle of magical realism chronicles 100 years and seven generations of the Buendía family in the mythical South American town of Macondo.

catalog.title: Parable of the Sower
catalog.author: Octavia E. Butler
catalog.description: Set in a bleak near-future California, 18-year-old Lauren suffers from hyperempathy—she feels others' pain as well as her own.

catalog.title: Ceremony
catalog.author: Leslie Marmon Silko
catalog.description: Set on an Indian reservation just after World War II, this story concerns the return home of Tayo, a war-weary Laguna Pueblo young man. While other returning soldiers find easy refuge in alcohol and senseless violence, Tayo searches for another kind of comfort and resolution in his heritage, traditions, and the ancient stories of his people.
